content:
Findings

  • £174,500 in likely duplicate payments (35 high-confidence groups)
  • £1.1 million in possible duplicates (335 medium-confidence groups)
  • £46,500 in suspected split payments (1 instance)

Proportional Impact

At £174,500 against £11.4 million total spend, Ribble Valley's duplicate rate of approximately 1.5% is the highest proportional rate of any Lancashire council we track. For a small council, even modest duplicate payments represent a meaningful portion of the budget.

However, this higher rate may partly reflect the smaller dataset — with fewer transactions, individual duplicates have a larger proportional impact. As more years of data become available, the true rate will become clearer.

View the evidence on our Spending page.
